sec.title: Background
sec.p: Websites like https://pilot.perm.pub use free open-source software, such as the Python package Epijats, to render Baseprint document snapshots into HTML pages and PDF files.

sec.title: Scope
sec.p: This document is a specification of the Baseprint Document Format (BpDF) for interoperability with reference free open-source software implementations. As of 2024, the only reference implementation is the Python package Epijats. Epijats is used by the authoring software Baseprinter and the website generation software BaseprintPress.

This specification does not define potential BpDF features that are not implemented in any software. The online forum at https://baseprints.singlesource.pub is available for communication about this living specification, its reference implementations, and other specifications related to Baseprint document snapshots.

sec.title: Directory Encoding
sec.p: Technically, BpDF is not a file format but rather a format for a directory-like data structure. This structure is addressable as a Git tree and SWHID directory.

When working with BpDF data, it is often temporarily stored in a file system directory. However, for public long-term storage, BpDF data is preserved in a SWHID addressable Git tree or an equivalent “directory” object in the Software Heritage Archive.
Inside BpDF, there is a file named article.xml encoded in a subset of the JATS XML format. This specification refers to this sub-format as Baseprint JATS XML.
